revised_title: Observations of Unusual Water Agitation in Dartmouth, November 1, 1755
tldr: A letter from Reverend Mr. Holdsworth describes a sudden and unusual agitation of waters in Dartmouth on November 1, 1755. Despite little wind, boats near the harbor tumbled and tossed, and the waters rose to a higher level than usual. This event lasted about three-quarters of an hour before returning to normal. The author notes that this phenomenon was not observed on the southern coast of Devonshire.
